name: BelleVue Beach Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are so sweet and helpful, bar staff will top u drink up as soon as it looks a little low, and its not like your paying for it so hey y not! The swimming pool was lovely temperature although some days when a lot of people were in and out u could see suncream around the edge! The beach is just down the steps from the pool and was very warm too almost as warm as the pool! The sand was beautiful and white just like u c in the brochures and never really expect to see when u arrive! The local 'plaza's' are great there is one called 'luxury avenue' it really is luxury with its inside water fAll effect walls and 100% genuine designer goods, but you will find the odd cheapy shop in there too. If you go to the further away plazas there is a big american type mall which is great! and also cheap! /we swam with dolphins which was the most amazing experiance ever and much cheaper thn we were imagined and had been told by friends! neway back to the hotel, the bedrooms are very comfortable no shower probs, lovely big towels, the room we had got 2 king size beds, we had a balcony looking over the beach which was so lovly especially when u have just woken up and open the curtains to what you would believe to be paradise! The food was delicious and everynight was themed. We would recommend this holiday to ne1!
reviews.title: BEST HOLIDAY I WANA LIVE THERE!

likes.disliked: — There was a tiny mosquito in the phone room one day lol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good - the price was good, so was breakfast, room appeared clean, waitresses nice, location near the Westin and Club Med made for great beach walking. Lots of people from England and Mexico vacationing there.
reviews.title: Good, Bad, and Bedbugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad - the lunch and dinner was just edible. Weather was rainy and windy so the pool bar etc was closed but pool looked small. Even from that location taxi to airport was $25. Drinks were served in six oz plastic cups. Since it was raining, all of the interior walkways and sports bar had an inch of water on it because of drainage problems. Very slippery - but they were constantly mopping it up.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

likes.disliked: — Room key would demagnatize, housekeeping tried to bust in our room at 8am while we were still sleeping

reviews.text: The Bedbugs - we only stayed one night but I woke up about 3 in the morning itching. In the morning I had over thrity extremely itchy bumps on my right arm, about half that on my left. Also, about 10 very itchy ones on both my upper thighs, knees, and feet. I have three huge ones on my neck and just a few on my back. My husband only had about a dozen on one arm, and half that on the other. I am quite alergic to Fleas (as I discovered on one trip to Florida) so I could have a stronger reation. I did not see any signs of bedbugs, but they were either bedbugs, fleas or chiggers (according to my research on webmd). I told the front desk when I checked out but they just shrugged. I stayed in room 3666. This happened Saturday night and I am still extremely itchy and it is Monday and I am back in Wisconsin. I should have paid the extra money and stayed at something nicer like the Gran Caribe Real.
reviews.title: Fun Place at a Great Price!

likes.disliked: — The slow check in and hotel shuts down at midnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I did not have an encounter with bedbugs - I would have rated the hotel acceptable for the price. By the way - I have never complained so much about a hotel before. Each day as I continue to itch - I kick myself for taking the cheap way!
reviews.title: Never go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our about out 8th trip to MX. We stayed at the Hotetur for one week in April, 2008. Upon arrival, we were informed that unless we paid $45.00, each for the all inclusive fee, that we could not even buy a drink. Since it was late at night it was not worth it.
reviews.title: Our experience at the Hotetur

reviews.text: I then asked the guy in charge at the front desk if we could just have a drink. He then said every guest was entitled to a free drink upon arrival. My wife and I then went to the bar for our "free" drink, and the bartender said he knew nothing of such a policy, and refused to give us our free drink. Even though the bar was 20 feet from the front desk, the bartender was not about to look over to the front desk & confirm, but was quite content to have me walk back around the bar & behind where he was standing & then over to the front desk, & then the front desk told him to give us a drink, or words to that effect , in Spanish.
reviews.title: Fun, safe, and inexpensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bartender then grudgingly poured us a lemonade- no booze, mind you. We were too tired to argue, so just let it go. After that experience, we just decided it was not worth it to do the "inclusive thing" at $90.00 a day for the two of us, and just ate and drank elsewhere.
reviews.title: Vacation time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not one of the staff was friendly to us, w/ the exception of the maid that cleaned our room. In fact, she was the only person nice to us the whole week we were there.(Excluding the guests - who were very nice). We were treated w/ a sort of benign indifference by all other staff our whole stay. Further, the English speaking skills of almost all the staff was poor, to nonexistent, which made things a bit more difficult.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

likes.liked: — Um...the bartenders in the lobby bar

reviews.text: The room was nice enough, and the beach was awesome. The pool area filled up w/ people claiming their spots with towels & other personal items at dawn, even though there were signs specifically prohibiting the practice. No one enforced the rule, & there were a lot more guests than space at the pool, or for the chairs at the beach. The pool was clean, though and overall, the place was pretty well maintained.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: This was my first time to Cancun, loved the resort, they were helpful, the food was excellent. And I must say, the beaches, wow those waves and the aqua water were awesome! I will definitely go again and book with this resort.
reviews.title: Awesome!

likes.liked: — The room was gorgeous, it had a beautiful view of the ocean with a balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This a property not worth going back to: I can't say that about most trips that I have been on in the past few years.maybe 20
reviews.title: Was NOT a 3* anything

likes.liked: — The Lady Who Cleaned Our Room Was Great!!
likes.disliked: — Bath Room Door Hit The Throne Bad Planing You Think?

reviews.title: excellent time!!
reviews.text: 1 Front desk wont let you in a room until after 3 but if you tip the manager he will get you in right away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 bar is under staffed ,unless you like martinis without olives I did not get any except the first day???
reviews.title: Nice time!

reviews.text: 3 you get to go to the fine dining restaurant only once for each week but you have to beg for a table the day of your booking the table then when you get there, you will find aprox 20 tables 8 occupied 2 waiters no bus boys and I asume since they can only handle one tabel each the place is only 1/3 full but your host will tell you that they are booked solid for days and days?? maybe they should hire a few servers to acutualy give you service???
reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!

likes.disliked: — Hot room with no relief from the heat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was amazing and do a good job a taking care of you. We had fun going out to the clubs with the hotel staff who arranged the entire outing. The food could have been better, however our room was amazing with a stunning view of the beach. I will definitely be back to this hotel. I felt like family.
reviews.title: Great Overall Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the most part the ratings on this Hotel are on the money. You can't beat the location. Very easy to get to and the service is fast and prompt. I arrived early and had no problem checking in early.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but theft on the beach

likes.disliked: — Vendors on the beach and stolen money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once inside I found my room spacious witha great view and overall very clean. The elevators worked, although in the morning only one did sometimes but I never wated long.
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.liked: — The pool and beach were nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you can see the property is very nice and the beach is wonderful. Now lets talk about the food. If your expecting wonderful, you will be greatly dissapointed. Breakfast is your best bet and lunch and dinner or ok. The Italian resturant isn't worth the time...trust me. The snack food was the worst. they only offer hamburgers, dogs and fries and the hamburgers were nasty.
reviews.title: This is a jewel

reviews.text: Now for the best. On my second day of a five day stay, I had what I believe to be the annoying vendors on the beach steal $500 out of my bag. After visiting the police station, I met several couples who had rings stolen off their fingers at the hospital and property out of cars and rooms. I never thought it could or would happen to me and this is my 5th time to Cancun in the past year and ahalf. BE VERY CAREFUL and never feel completely safe with your valuables
reviews.title: Older, outdated hotel

description: Hotel in Cancun, just on the beach, between the turquoise waters of the Mexican Caribbean and Nichtupe lagoon. Offering a variety of restaurants and bars, it's unbeatable for enjoying the beaches and natural surrounds.
